analyzed: jātaka  chakka nipāta  a vāriya vagga
translated: Birth Stories🔽The Group of Sixes
The Chapter on the Unprotected🔽The Birth Story of Migālopa
“I do not like it, Migālopa,

original: yassa te tādisī gatī;🔽Atuccaṁ tāta patasi,🔽abhūmiṁ tāta sevasi.
analyzed: yassa te tādisī gatī  atuccam tāta patasi  abhūmim tāta sevasi
translated: that you have such a fate.
You do not fall down low, my son,
but you serve the ground, my son.🔽When the earth is like a lotus with four petals,
then, my son, you should turn back,
do not go beyond this point.”
“There are other birds too,
flying through the air with wings;
without being thrown by the force of the wind,
they are lost, as if they were eternal.
Without doing what my father,
my old father, said,
I went beyond the timely wind
and came under the power of Verambhā.
His sons and wives,
and those who lived with him,
all came to ruin,
because they did not heed the advice.

original: Evampi idha vuddhānaṁ,🔽yo vākyaṁ nāvabujjhati;🔽Atisīmacaro ditto,
analyzed: evampi idha  yaḥ vākyam na avabujjhati  ati sīma caraḥ dittaḥ
translated: In the same way, those here who do not understand🔽the words of the elders,
who wander beyond the boundaries, intoxicated,🔽who have gone beyond the teachings of the Buddha,
all come to ruin,
without doing the teachings of the elders.”
The Birth Story of Migālopa, the sixth.
